source.08a2a17e:
import plotly.express as px
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
source.b03a4885:
lbl_cnts = df_train.groupby('Label')['Label'].count().reset_index(name = 'Counts').sort_values(by = 'Counts', ascending = False)
fig = px.bar(lbl_cnts[:20], x='Label', y='Counts', color = 'Label', title = 'Top 20 Label combinations')
fig.show()
source.be6d94d0:
ls = []
for ele in df_train.Label:
    ls.append(ele.split('|'))
flat_list = [int(item) for sublist in ls for item in sublist]
df = pd.DataFrame(dict((i, flat_list.count(i)) for i in flat_list).items(), columns = ['key','value'])
fig = px.bar(df, x='key', y='value', color = 'key', title = 'Unique Label distribution')
fig.show()
source.7c482d58:
file_id = '5c27f04c-bb99-11e8-b2b9-ac1f6b6435d0'
colors = ['_red','_green','_yellow','_blue']
file_name = '/kaggle/input/hpa-single-cell-image-classification/train/'
plt.figure(figsize=(20,20))
#RED
file = file_name+file_id+colors[0]+'.png'
img = plt.imread(file)
plt.subplot(2, 2, 1)
plt.imshow(img)
plt.title("RED")
#GREEN
file = file_name+file_id+colors[1]+'.png'
img = plt.imread(file)
plt.subplot(2, 2, 2)
plt.imshow(img)
plt.title("GREEN")
#YELLOW
file = file_name+file_id+colors[2]+'.png'
img = plt.imread(file)
plt.subplot(2, 2, 3)
plt.imshow(img)
plt.title("YELLOW")
#BLUE
file = file_name+file_id+colors[3]+'.png'
img = plt.imread(file)
plt.subplot(2, 2, 4)
plt.imshow(img)
plt.title("BLUE")

#Label 0
zero = df_train[df_train.Label == '0']
file_id = zero['ID'][zero.first_valid_index()]
plt.figure(figsize=(20,20))
#RED
file = file_name+file_id+colors[0]+'.png'
img = plt.imread(file)

source.6f0d64ab: **Unique Label distribution is to know the individual counts of each Label. Nucleoplasm(0) and Cytosol(16) are having high number of Cell samples.**
